intro: Epilobium clavatotrichon, commonly known as the woolly willow or hairy willow, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its erect, often branched stems covered in dense, glandular hairs. The leaves are typically opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and also bear a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and have five petals, often pink or reddish in color. This plant thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along stream banks and in wet meadows.
